Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: ドバル
Entry.EnglishText: Doval

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ・酋長の家
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista - Chief's House

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ・酋長の家
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista - Chief's House

Entry.JapaneseText: 酋長の家
Entry.EnglishText: Chief's House

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺は酋長のドバルだ。 礼儀も知らないヒューマを連れて、 この俺に何の用だ？
Entry.EnglishText: I am Chief Doval. Why have you come here with these ill-mannered Huma in tow?

Entry.JapaneseText: 礼儀知らずってのは、 おれたちの事か!?
Entry.EnglishText: Just who are you calling ill-mannered!?

Entry.JapaneseText: 待て、<Tytree>……
Entry.EnglishText: Stop it, <Tytree>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は<Eugene>・ガラルドという者です。 酋長にお話があって参りました。
Entry.EnglishText: My name is <Eugene> Gallardo. We've come here to discuss something with you, if you do not mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>……？ あんたはもしや、<Blue>王の盾<White>の隊長か？
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>...? Would you by any chance happen to be the Commander of the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい、「元」が付きますが。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, although my title is <Italic>ex</Italic>-Commander now.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうか。 あんたの事は以前より聞いている。 我らガジュマが誇る最高の戦士だとな。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I see. I've heard about you before. Your prowess as a soldier is a source of pride for us Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 無礼者、しかもヒューマとは 口を利く気にはなれんが、 あんたとなら話をしてもいい。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no desire to talk with insolent Huma, but I'd be fine talking to you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 彼らはこの地の流儀を知らないだけで、 無礼なわけではありません。 その辺はご理解ください。
Entry.EnglishText: They are simply unfamiliar with the customs of this land, they mean no offense. I request your understanding of that.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……所詮、ヒューマはヒューマだな。 それで、あんたの話とはなんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Huma will be Huma, I guess. So, what do you want to talk about?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい、先ほど捕らえられた ヒューマの若者の事を、 お聞かせいただけませんか？ ハックは我々の知人なのです。
Entry.EnglishText: If it's not a problem, may I ask you about the situation with the Huma who was just apprehended? His name is Hack, and he is an acquaintance of ours.

Entry.JapaneseText: 我々の聖域を侵したあの冒とく者の ヒューマとも知り合いなのか!?
Entry.EnglishText: You mean to tell me that you know that Huma blasphemer who trespassed upon our holy site!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ。 その聖域とは一体何ですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Yes. Just what is your holy site, if I may ask?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……この奥の部屋には、 太古の昔より、我が部族が 大切に守り続けている <Cyan>聖壇<White>と呼ばれるものがある。
Entry.EnglishText: ...In this back room, there is a <Cyan>sacred altar<White> that our tribe has been carefully watching over since time immemorial.

Entry.JapaneseText: あろう事か、あのヒューマは その部屋に忍び込み、火を放って、 <Cyan>聖壇<White>を傷つけようとしたのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: That Huma slipped by unnoticed into the room and started a fire in an attempt to deface it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>聖壇<White>を傷つける？ ハックは考古学を研究しています。 これはきっと何かの誤解です。 話を聞いてやってくださいませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: He was trying to deface your <Cyan>sacred altar<White>? Hack is an archaeologist. There must be some sort of misunderstanding. Have you heard his side of the story?

Entry.JapaneseText: 断る！ ヒューマと語るなど身の毛もよだつ。 本来なら、ヒューマの姿を見るのも 不快なのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: No! The thought of talking to a Huma makes my hair stand on end. Just looking at them makes me uncomfortable.

Entry.JapaneseText: では、私にハックと話をする 許可を与えてくださいませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: If that's the case, then may I have your permission to go talk with him?

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックの行いが、本当に<Cyan>聖壇<White>を 冒とくするものだったのかどうか、 私に確かめさせてください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please allow me to ascertain whether or not Hack was truly intent on desecrating the <Cyan>altar<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なぜ、ヒューマのために ガジュマのあんたがそこまでする？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Why would a Gajuma want to help a Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 知人を助けたいだけです。
Entry.EnglishText: I only want to help an acquaintance.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……よかろう。ただし、<Cyan>聖壇<White>を 再び傷つけるような事があれば、 あんたが我らガジュマの誉れ高き 戦士であろうと、罪から免れぬぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Go ahead. But if anything else happens to the <Cyan>altar<White>, even an honorable Gajuma warrior like yourself will suffer the consequences.

Entry.JapaneseText: 承知しました…… ありがとうございます。
Entry.EnglishText: I understand. You have my gratitude.

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックのところへ行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go find Hack.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Why...

Entry.JapaneseText: 誇り高きガジュマの戦士が どうして、ヒューマのために そこまでする……？
Entry.EnglishText: Why would a proud Gajuma warrior like yourself go so far for a Huma...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの話を 聞く耳は持たぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうした？ 何かあのハックというのを 助ける手立てでも考えついたか？
Entry.EnglishText: Well? What excuse did that Hack give to defend himself?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>聖壇<White>を見せてもらう <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>を復活させる <Cyan>聖壇<White>への捧げ物の話を聞く なんでもない
Entry.EnglishText: Let us inspect the <Cyan>altar<White>. Let us resurrect the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>. Ask about <Cyan>offerings.<White> Nothing.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>聖壇<White>を見せてもらう <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>を復活させる
Entry.EnglishText: Let us inspect the <Cyan>altar<White>. Let us resurrect the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: くれぐれも<Cyan>聖壇<White>を けがすような事をするなよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't you dare defile the altar like that blasphemer.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと待て、<Veigue>。 復活させると言っても、 何をどうすればいいか、 わからないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hold on, <Veigue>. We still don't know how that's supposed to be done.

Entry.JapaneseText: もうちょっと調べてから 来ようよ、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's investigate a little more first, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>を復活させる？
Entry.EnglishText: You want to revive the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい、ハックの無実を 証明してみせます。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes. Allow me to prove Hack's innocence.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと待て、<Veigue>。 復活させると言っても、 何をどうすればいいか、 わからないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hold on, <Veigue>. We still don't know how that's supposed to be done.

Entry.JapaneseText: もうちょっと調べてから 来ようよ、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's investigate a little more first, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>聖壇<White>に捧げる物？ その話は知っているが、 捧げ物が何かを確かめようと 思った事はない。
Entry.EnglishText: You want to give an offering to the <Cyan>sacred altar<White>? I've heard of such a thing, but I've never thought to find out what would have been offered.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの話を 聞く耳は持たぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say...

Entry.JapaneseText: 約束だ…… 仕方がない。
Entry.EnglishText: Very well, I shall uphold my promise.

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、聖壇を汚さぬよう、 あのヒューマには きつく言いつけておいてほしい。
Entry.EnglishText: But do make sure that Huma is keenly aware that he is not to defile the altar.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの話を 聞く耳は持たぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say...

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックなら、 聖壇のところにおるだろう。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for Hack, he's currently at the altar.

Entry.JapaneseText: 奴が妙な事をせんか、 見ていて欲しい。
Entry.EnglishText: But keep an eye on him, he's likely to do something strange.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの話を 聞く耳は持たぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今度は何の用だ？
Entry.EnglishText: What is it this time?

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックを探しているのですが、 何かご存知ありませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: We're trying to find Hack. Would you happen to know where he is?

Entry.JapaneseText: あのヒューマの男なら、 ラジルダへ行くと言っていた。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for that Huma, he said he was going to Razilda.

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダですか。 ありがとうございます。
Entry.EnglishText: He's headed to Razilda, huh... Thank you very much.

Entry.JapaneseText: 待て……<Eugene>よ。
Entry.EnglishText: Wait, <Eugene>...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたが何をしているかには興味はない。 だが、そうしてヒューマと共にいる事は あんたのためにはなるまい。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no interest in what you are doing, but staying in the company of these Huma will bring you nothing but trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: 特に、そのヒューマの娘…… ガジュマが気に食わんようだな。 俺を見る時の目つきを見ればわかる。
Entry.EnglishText: In particular, that Huma girl bears a strong hatred for Gajuma. I can see it in her eyes when she looks at me.

Entry.JapaneseText: それはこの娘が 悪いのではなく……
Entry.EnglishText: She means no harm.

Entry.JapaneseText: その娘だけに限った話ではない。 種族間の争いの種は、 どこにでも転がっている。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not just talking about that girl. The seeds of racial conflict are scattered about everywhere.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……道はふたつにひとつ。 我らのように他を寄せつけぬか、 主従の関係を作るか。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Eventually, our paths will merge. Either one side will hide away from the outside world, as we do here, or one will become the slave while the other becomes the master.

Entry.JapaneseText: 酋長さんよ、もうひとつあるぜ!! 「お互いを認め合う」ってヤツがな。
Entry.EnglishText: Hey Chief, there's another option called "respecting one another!"

Entry.JapaneseText: 理想論だな。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, aren't you an idealist.

Entry.JapaneseText: 理想のどこが悪い？
Entry.EnglishText: What's wrong with being an idealist?

Entry.JapaneseText: 理想ばかり追っていては、 そこに実は残らん、そういう事だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Those who chase after ideals will get left behind by reality.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……各地で種族間の争いが 起こっているのは知っている。 だが、驚く事ではなかろう。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm aware that fighting has been breaking out between the races. It doesn't surprise me, though.

Entry.JapaneseText: この村へも、ヒューマの賊が現れたり、 軍が兵士を駐留させろと言って 圧力をかけて来るようになった。
Entry.EnglishText: Even our town has been facing incursions by Huma bandits, and the military has been pestering me to have soldiers stationed here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍の将軍ミルハウストはヒューマだ。 奴は、この村をも支配下に置こうと 考えたのだろう。
Entry.EnglishText: The general of the army, Milhaust, is a Huma. I believe he intends to have this village under his control as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: しかし、ミルハウストは そのような人物では……
Entry.EnglishText: But Milhaust is not the type of man to...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの肩を持つのか？ あの男の評判を知らないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: You're taking the side of a Huma? Have you not heard of that man's reputation?

Entry.JapaneseText: 評判？
Entry.EnglishText: His reputation?

Entry.JapaneseText: 奴は、争いが起こると必ず現れ、 有無を言わさず関係者を 捕らえて投獄する。
Entry.EnglishText: Whenever a conflict occurs, he's soon there to have any involved persons forcibly incarcerated.

Entry.JapaneseText: そして、その土地に 軍を駐留させるのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: And then, he leaves his army stationed there.

Entry.JapaneseText: これは、奴による ヒューマ支配国家への 第一歩だと、俺は考えている。
Entry.EnglishText: I think that's just one step in him turning this nation into a Kingdom controlled by Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: しかし……
Entry.EnglishText: But...

Entry.JapaneseText: そう、しかし……だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes... "But."

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたのように、 ミルハウストやヒューマを かばおうとする者がいる。
Entry.EnglishText: Even here, there are those who, like you, would stick their necks out for the likes of Milhaust and other Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: このままでは、村の秩序は乱れ、 ヒューマに付け入られてしまう。
Entry.EnglishText: At this rate, the order of Pipista will be disrupted, and the Huma will take advantage of that.

Entry.JapaneseText: ゆえに、俺は村の者たちを 姿ごとに分け、階級を作る事で、 規律と秩序を保つ事にしたのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Therefore, I decided to separate the villagers based on appearance and establish a class system so that law and order can be maintained.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……それで、村はうまく いっているのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: And is that working out well for the village?

Entry.JapaneseText: もちろんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course it is.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……姿で分けたと言ったが、 あんたたちは皆、 ガジュマじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: You said that you separated everyone based on how they look, but aren't you all Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が言いたい？
Entry.EnglishText: What are you trying to say?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……姿が違っても同じガジュマなら、 オレたちヒューマは、 なぜガジュマじゃないんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: If you can all look different and yet still be the same race, then why can't we Huma be considered Gajuma, as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたの言う、 種族とは何だ？
Entry.EnglishText: What does "race" even mean to you?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマにそんな事を 言われる筋合いはない。
Entry.EnglishText: A Huma has no right to ask me such a thing.

Entry.JapaneseText: 出ていけ…… 今すぐこの村から！
Entry.EnglishText: Get out of here... Leave this village at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: 出ていけ、と言ったのが 聞こえなかったのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Did you not hear me tell you to get out the first time I said it?

Entry.JapaneseText: トッポとレイが……？
Entry.EnglishText: Topp and Rei are...?

Entry.JapaneseText: むむ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmmm...

Entry.JapaneseText: 二人を助けてくれたことには 感謝する。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for saving those two children.

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、あくまでもこの村の問題だ。 これ以上、余計な真似はしないでもらおう。
Entry.EnglishText: But this is a matter for our village. Please do not involve yourself more than you already have.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの話を 聞く耳は持たぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今までに耳にした事のない音…… 世界が破滅に向かう音か……？
Entry.EnglishText: I've never heard this kind of sound before... Is it the sound that marks the end of the world...?

Entry.JapaneseText: それもまたよし、か……
Entry.EnglishText: Or is it perhaps a sign of something good...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマは出ていけ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Huma, get out of here...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……何をしに来た？
Entry.EnglishText: ...What are you doing here?

Entry.JapaneseText: 出て行け。 ヒューマと話すことなど何もない。
Entry.EnglishText: Get out. I have nothing to say to a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 我らは皆、ヒト……
Entry.EnglishText: We are all human beings...

Entry.JapaneseText: 間違っていたのかも知れん。 階級という考え方が……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps I was mistaken. This whole idea of a social caste...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の用事だ？ 用事がないなら、帰ってくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: What is your business? If you have none, then leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの話を 聞く耳は持たぬ……
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to listen to anything a Huma has to say...

Entry.JapaneseText: あのハックとかいうヒューマを 呼びに行くのではないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Weren't you going to fetch that Huma named Hack?
Entry.Notes: I purposely used Hack Huma since Chief Doval doesn't think highly of Hack and Huma in general

Entry.JapaneseText: 待て……！ 我らの<Cyan>聖壇<White>に 無断で立ち入るとは 何のつもりだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Stop...! You dare enter the <Cyan>sacred altar<White> without permission?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『グリューネルカクタスの鉢植え』 年中、白い花を咲かせているサボテン。 成長すると、全長５メートルに達し、 直径６０センチの見事な大輪を咲かせる事も。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Potted Gruener Cactus - This cactus blooms with white flowers all year round. When it fully matures, it can reach a height of 5 meters and produce a stunningly large flower that spans 60 cm in diameter.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ナン』 ピピスタの主食。 小麦粉に卵、水などを混ぜて よく練り、発酵させ、かまどで こんがりと焼き上げたもの。 そのままでもそこはかとない 甘さを含む味だが、スープ類に つけて食べると格別。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Naan - The staple food of Pipista. It is made from mixing flour, eggs, water, and other ingredients together. Knead it thoroughly, ferment it, and then bake it until it browns. It is quite sweet on its own, but tastes exceptional when served with soups and other dishes.
